fact_check_explanation_title: The UK’s adverts watchdog has banned a misleading advert about 5G
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Advertising Standards Authority banned an advert which made unsubstantiated claims about the health impacts of 5G.

fact_check_explanation_title: President Obama does not plan to govern Kenya next
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims this is the case are based on a joke article about Barack Obama wanting to be president of Kenya

fact_check_explanation_title: Mixing baby oil and iodine won’t remove body hair
fact_check_explanation_summary: Iodine and baby oil isn’t an alternative to shaving.

fact_check_explanation_title: This is not an official Extinction Rebellion sticker
fact_check_explanation_summary: This has been done by another group who make materials in the style of the climate activists.

fact_check_explanation_title: Japan does accept a small number of official refugees
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that Japan doesn’t take in any refugees are false.

fact_check_explanation_title: This Boris Johnson quote has been edited and taken out of context
fact_check_explanation_summary: Two sentences from an article written by Mr Johnson in a 2013 article arguing for and against Brexit have been edited together.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s limited evidence that lie detectors will be effective on terror offenders
fact_check_explanation_summary: Lie detectors aren’t accurate, but that’s not the only measure of their worth.

fact_check_explanation_title: Quarter of private renters experience sickness over housing worries—but we don’t know if private renting is the cause
fact_check_explanation_summary: A quarter of private renters agree that housing worries have made them ill. The Guardian claimed private renting is the cause which confuses correlation and causation.

fact_check_explanation_title: This claim that 2,000 people have died waiting for benefits since a Universal Credit review was announced needs context
fact_check_explanation_summary: The estimate is an average based on how many people died between 2013 and 2018 waiting for a decision on their Personal Independence Payment decision.

fact_check_explanation_title: Jeremy Hunt muddled the numbers on botched surgeries
fact_check_explanation_summary: Jeremy Hunt said the NHS operates on the wrong part of someone’s body four times a day. It’s actually four times a week.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s very unlikely that fewer knife offenders are facing jail
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims from Labour about knife crime sentencing aren’t comparing like-with-like.

fact_check_explanation_title: A Bill to change referendum rules came from one Lord, not the government
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Bill proposing changes to the rules around referendums has been put forward by a Conservative Lord, but has not been endorsed by the party or government.
